metadata.section_title: Validity requirements for a Charity Worker

chunks.text:
### Validity requirements for a Charity Worker

CW 1.1. A person applying for entry clearance or permission to stay as a Charity Worker must apply online on gov.uk on the specified form as follows:

| Applicant | Specified form |
| --- | --- |
| EEA national with a chipped passport | Either: •Temporary Worker using the UK Immigration: ID Check app; or • the forms listed below for applicants outside or inside the UK (as relevant) |
| Applicants outside the UK | Temporary Worker visa |
| Applicants inside the UK | Temporary Worker |

1.   CW 1.2. An application for entry clearance or permission to stay as a Charity Worker must meet all the following requirements: 
    1.   (a) any fee and Immigration Health Charge must have been paid; and
    2.   (b) the applicant must have provided biometrics when required; and
    3.   (c) the applicant must have provided a passport or other travel document which satisfactorily establishes their identity and nationality; and
    4.   (d) the applicant must have a Certificate of Sponsorship that was issued to them no more than 3 months before the date of application.

CW 1.3. The applicant must be aged 18 or over on the date of application.

CW 1.4. If applying for permission to stay, the applicant must be in the UK on the date of application.

CW 1.4A. If applying for permission to stay, the applicant must have, or have last had, permission as a Charity Worker.

CW 1.5. An application which does not meet all the validity requirements for a Charity Worker may be rejected as invalid and not considered.
chunks.summary: Charity Worker applicants must apply online using specified forms, pay fees, provide biometrics and identification, and hold a valid Certificate of Sponsorship issued within three months. They must be 18 or over and, if applying for permission to stay, be in the UK with prior valid permission. Exceptions apply based on applicant status and application timing.

### Validity requirements for a Charity Worker

CW 1.1. A person applying for entry clearance or permission to stay as a Charity Worker must apply online on gov.uk on the specified form as follows:

| Applicant | Specified form |
| --- | --- |
| EEA national with a chipped passport | Either: •Temporary Worker using the UK Immigration: ID Check app; or • the forms listed below for applicants outside or inside the UK (as relevant) |
| Applicants outside the UK | Temporary Worker visa |
| Applicants inside the UK | Temporary Worker |

1.   CW 1.2. An application for entry clearance or permission to stay as a Charity Worker must meet all the following requirements: 
    1.   (a) any fee and Immigration Health Charge must have been paid; and
    2.   (b) the applicant must have provided biometrics when required; and
    3.   (c) the applicant must have provided a passport or other travel document which satisfactorily establishes their identity and nationality; and
    4.   (d) the applicant must have a Certificate of Sponsorship that was issued to them no more than 3 months before the date of application.

CW 1.3. The applicant must be aged 18 or over on the date of application.

CW 1.4. If applying for permission to stay, the applicant must be in the UK on the date of application.

CW 1.4A. If applying for permission to stay, the applicant must have, or have last had, permission as a Charity Worker.

CW 1.5. An application which does not meet all the validity requirements for a Charity Worker may be rejected as invalid and not considered.

metadata.section_title: Suitability requirements for a Charity Worker

chunks.text:
### Suitability requirements for a Charity Worker

CW 2.1. The applicant must not fall for refusal under Part Suitability.

1.   CW 2.2. If applying for permission to stay the applicant must not be: 
    1.   (a) in breach of immigration laws, except that where the Exceptions for overstayers section of Part Suitability applies, that period of overstaying will be disregarded; or
    2.   (b) on immigration bail.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to charity worker applicants. They must not breach immigration laws (excluding certain overstays) or be on immigration bail to be considered suitable for permission to stay.

CW 2.1. The applicant must not fall for refusal under Part Suitability.

1.   CW 2.2. If applying for permission to stay the applicant must not be: 
    1.   (a) in breach of immigration laws, except that where the Exceptions for overstayers section of Part Suitability applies, that period of overstaying will be disregarded; or
    2.   (b) on immigration bail.

metadata.section_id: Eligibility requirements for a Charity Worker
metadata.section_title: Eligibility requirements for a Charity Worker

chunks.text: ### Eligibility requirements for a Charity Worker
chunks.summary: This provision applies to individuals applying as Charity Workers. Applicants must meet specified eligibility criteria, including demonstrating they will work for a recognized charity and meet the relevant conditions. Critical thresholds or exceptions are not specified in this excerpt.
chunks.augmented_text:

Part: Appendix Temporary Work - Charity Worker

Section: Eligibility requirements for a Charity Worker
Topic: eligibility

Summary: This provision applies to individuals applying as Charity Workers. Applicants must meet specified eligibility criteria, including demonstrating they will work for a recognized charity and meet the relevant conditions. Critical thresholds or exceptions are not specified in this excerpt.

### Eligibility requirements for a Charity Worker

metadata.section_title: Entry requirements for a Charity Worker

chunks.text:
### Entry requirements for a Charity Worker

CW 3.1. A person seeking to come to the UK on the Charity Worker route must have applied for and obtained entry clearance as a Charity Worker before they arrive in the UK.

CW 3.2. A person applying for entry clearance as a Charity Worker must, if Appendix Tuberculosis applies, provide a valid medical certificate confirming that they have undergone screening for active pulmonary tuberculosis and that this tuberculosis is not present in them.

CW 3.3. An applicant for entry clearance must not have had permission as a Religious Worker or Charity Worker at any time during the 12 months immediately before the date of application unless they can show they were not in the UK at any time during those 12 months.
chunks.summary: Charity Workers seeking entry to the UK must obtain prior entry clearance as a Charity Worker, and, if applicable, provide a TB screening certificate; recent permission as a Religious or Charity Worker within the past 12 months may disqualify unless they were not in the UK during that period.
chunks.augmented_text:
Document: Appendix Temporary Work - Charity Worker
Part: Appendix Temporary Work - Charity Worker

Summary: Charity Workers seeking entry to the UK must obtain prior entry clearance as a Charity Worker, and, if applicable, provide a TB screening certificate; recent permission as a Religious or Charity Worker within the past 12 months may disqualify unless they were not in the UK during that period.

### Entry requirements for a Charity Worker

CW 3.1. A person seeking to come to the UK on the Charity Worker route must have applied for and obtained entry clearance as a Charity Worker before they arrive in the UK.

CW 3.2. A person applying for entry clearance as a Charity Worker must, if Appendix Tuberculosis applies, provide a valid medical certificate confirming that they have undergone screening for active pulmonary tuberculosis and that this tuberculosis is not present in them.

CW 3.3. An applicant for entry clearance must not have had permission as a Religious Worker or Charity Worker at any time during the 12 months immediately before the date of application unless they can show they were not in the UK at any time during those 12 months.

metadata.section_title: Sponsorship requirement for a Charity Worker

chunks.text:
### Sponsorship requirement for a Charity Worker

1.   CW 4.1. The applicant must have a valid Certificate of Sponsorship for the job they are planning to do; which to be valid must: 
    1.   (a) confirm the applicant’s name, that they are being sponsored as a Charity Worker, details of the job the sponsor is offering them; and
    2.   (b) include a start date, stated by the sponsor, which is no more than three months after the date of application; and
    3.   (c) not have been used in a previous application which was either granted or refused (but can have been used in a previous application which was rejected as invalid, made void or withdrawn); and
    4.   (d) not have been withdrawn by the sponsor or cancelled by the Home Office; and
    5.   (e) include confirmation that the role meets the requirement at CW 4.2.

2.   CW 4.2. The sponsor must ensure the role meets the following requirements: 
    1.   (a) it is voluntary fieldwork which contributes directly to the achievement or advancement of the sponsor’s charitable purpose; and
    2.   (b) it must be voluntary work and not be paid or otherwise remunerated, including receipt of benefits in kind, except for reasonable expenses and the provision of accommodation as is reasonable in the circumstances as defined in the National Minimum Wage Act 1988; and
    3.   (c) the applicant must not be filling a permanent position, including on a temporary basis.

CW 4.3. The sponsor must be authorised by the Home Office to sponsor the job in question under the Charity Worker route.

CW 4.4. The sponsor must be listed as A-rated on the Home Office’s register of licensed sponsors, unless the applicant was last granted permission as a Charity Worker and is applying to continue working for the same sponsor as in their last permission.

CW 4.5. The decision maker must not have reasonable grounds to believe the job the applicant is being sponsored to do does not comply with the National Minimum Wage Regulations or the Working Time Regulations.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to applicants seeking to work as Charity Workers under the UK Immigration Rules. They must hold a valid Certificate of Sponsorship confirming their role, which must meet voluntary, non-remunerated criteria and not fill a permanent position; the certificate’s validity depends on specific conditions and must be issued within three months of application.

### Sponsorship requirement for a Charity Worker

1.   CW 4.1. The applicant must have a valid Certificate of Sponsorship for the job they are planning to do; which to be valid must: 
    1.   (a) confirm the applicant’s name, that they are being sponsored as a Charity Worker, details of the job the sponsor is offering them; and
    2.   (b) include a start date, stated by the sponsor, which is no more than three months after the date of application; and
    3.   (c) not have been used in a previous application which was either granted or refused (but can have been used in a previous application which was rejected as invalid, made void or withdrawn); and
    4.   (d) not have been withdrawn by the sponsor or cancelled by the Home Office; and
    5.   (e) include confirmation that the role meets the requirement at CW 4.2.

2.   CW 4.2. The sponsor must ensure the role meets the following requirements: 
    1.   (a) it is voluntary fieldwork which contributes directly to the achievement or advancement of the sponsor’s charitable purpose; and
    2.   (b) it must be voluntary work and not be paid or otherwise remunerated, including receipt of benefits in kind, except for reasonable expenses and the provision of accommodation as is reasonable in the circumstances as defined in the National Minimum Wage Act 1988; and
    3.   (c) the applicant must not be filling a permanent position, including on a temporary basis.

CW 4.3. The sponsor must be authorised by the Home Office to sponsor the job in question under the Charity Worker route.

CW 4.4. The sponsor must be listed as A-rated on the Home Office’s register of licensed sponsors, unless the applicant was last granted permission as a Charity Worker and is applying to continue working for the same sponsor as in their last permission.

CW 4.5. The decision maker must not have reasonable grounds to believe the job the applicant is being sponsored to do does not comply with the National Minimum Wage Regulations or the Working Time Regulations.

metadata.section_title: Genuineness requirement for a Charity Worker

chunks.text:
### Genuineness requirement for a Charity Worker

1.   CW 5.1. The applicant must: 
    1.   (a) genuinely intend, and be able, to undertake the role for which they are being sponsored; and
    2.   (b) not intend to undertake employment other than in the role for which they are being sponsored, or as otherwise permitted by paragraph CW 8.3.
chunks.summary: Charity Worker applicants must genuinely intend and be capable of performing the sponsored role, and restrict employment to that role unless permitted. They must not intend to undertake other employment beyond their sponsored position.

Summary: Charity Worker applicants must genuinely intend and be capable of performing the sponsored role, and restrict employment to that role unless permitted. They must not intend to undertake other employment beyond their sponsored position.

### Genuineness requirement for a Charity Worker

1.   CW 5.1. The applicant must: 
    1.   (a) genuinely intend, and be able, to undertake the role for which they are being sponsored; and
    2.   (b) not intend to undertake employment other than in the role for which they are being sponsored, or as otherwise permitted by paragraph CW 8.3.

metadata.section_title: Financial Requirement for a Charity Worker

chunks.text:
### Financial Requirement for a Charity Worker

CW 6.1. If the applicant is applying for permission to stay and has been in the UK with permission for 12 months or longer on the date of application, they will meet the financial requirement and do not need to show funds.

1.   CW 6.2. If the applicant is applying for entry clearance, or is applying for permission to stay and has been in the UK for less than 12 months on the date of application, either: 
    1.   (a) the applicant must have funds of at least £1,270; or
    2.   (b) the applicant’s A rated sponsor must confirm on the Certificate of Sponsorship that they will, if it is necessary, maintain and accommodate the applicant up to the end of the first month of their employment for an amount of at least £1,270.

CW 6.3. If CW 6.2.(a) applies, the applicant must show that they have held the required level of funds for a 28-day period and as specified in Appendix Finance.
chunks.summary: Charity Worker applicants in the UK must have £1,270 in funds if in the country for less than 12 months or obtain sponsor confirmation; those in the UK for over 12 months are deemed to meet the financial requirement without additional proof.
chunks.augmented_text:

Topic: financial

Summary: Charity Worker applicants in the UK must have £1,270 in funds if in the country for less than 12 months or obtain sponsor confirmation; those in the UK for over 12 months are deemed to meet the financial requirement without additional proof.

### Financial Requirement for a Charity Worker

CW 6.1. If the applicant is applying for permission to stay and has been in the UK with permission for 12 months or longer on the date of application, they will meet the financial requirement and do not need to show funds.

1.   CW 6.2. If the applicant is applying for entry clearance, or is applying for permission to stay and has been in the UK for less than 12 months on the date of application, either: 
    1.   (a) the applicant must have funds of at least £1,270; or
    2.   (b) the applicant’s A rated sponsor must confirm on the Certificate of Sponsorship that they will, if it is necessary, maintain and accommodate the applicant up to the end of the first month of their employment for an amount of at least £1,270.

CW 6.3. If CW 6.2.(a) applies, the applicant must show that they have held the required level of funds for a 28-day period and as specified in Appendix Finance.

metadata.section_title: Decision on an application as a Charity Worker

chunks.text:
### Decision on an application as a Charity Worker

CW 7.1. If the decision maker is satisfied that all the suitability and eligibility requirements for the Charity Worker route are met, the application will be granted, otherwise the application will be refused.

CW 7.2. If the application is refused, the person can apply for an Administrative Review under Appendix AR: Administrative Review.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to applicants for the Charity Worker route. Decisions depend on meeting all suitability and eligibility criteria; applications are granted if satisfied, otherwise refused, with refusals eligible for Administrative Review.
chunks.augmented_text:

Section: Decision on an application as a Charity Worker
Topic: eligibility

Summary: This provision applies to applicants for the Charity Worker route. Decisions depend on meeting all suitability and eligibility criteria; applications are granted if satisfied, otherwise refused, with refusals eligible for Administrative Review.

### Decision on an application as a Charity Worker

CW 7.1. If the decision maker is satisfied that all the suitability and eligibility requirements for the Charity Worker route are met, the application will be granted, otherwise the application will be refused.

CW 7.2. If the application is refused, the person can apply for an Administrative Review under Appendix AR: Administrative Review.

metadata.section_title: Period of grant for a Charity Worker

chunks.text:
### Period of grant for a Charity Worker

1.   CW 8.1. If the application is for entry clearance, the applicant will be granted whichever is the shorter of: 
    1.   (a) the period of the job on the Certificate of Sponsorship plus 14 days before and after; or
    2.   (b) 12 months.

2.   CW 8.2. If the application is for permission to stay, the applicant will be granted whichever is the shorter of: 
    1.   (a) the period of the job on the Certificate of Sponsorship plus 14 days; or
    2.   (b) the difference between the period the applicant has already spent in the UK since their last grant of permission as a Charity Worker and 12 months.
chunks.summary: Charity Workers applying for entry clearance or permission to stay are granted a period up to 12 months or the sponsorship period plus 14 days, whichever is shorter. For those already in the UK, the stay cannot exceed 12 months minus their existing time in the UK, ensuring a maximum one-year duration.
chunks.augmented_text:

For those already in the UK, the stay cannot exceed 12 months minus their existing time in the UK, ensuring a maximum one-year duration.

### Period of grant for a Charity Worker

1.   CW 8.1. If the application is for entry clearance, the applicant will be granted whichever is the shorter of: 
    1.   (a) the period of the job on the Certificate of Sponsorship plus 14 days before and after; or
    2.   (b) 12 months.

2.   CW 8.2. If the application is for permission to stay, the applicant will be granted whichever is the shorter of: 
    1.   (a) the period of the job on the Certificate of Sponsorship plus 14 days; or
    2.   (b) the difference between the period the applicant has already spent in the UK since their last grant of permission as a Charity Worker and 12 months.

metadata.section_title: Conditions of grant for a Charity Worker

chunks.text:
### Conditions of grant for a Charity Worker

1.   CW 8.3. The grant will be subject to all the following conditions: 
    1.   (a) no access to public funds; and
    2.   (b) work is permitted only in the role the applicant is being sponsored for; and
    3.   (c) voluntary work with another organisation is permitted, providing it is in the same role as the one listed on the Certificate of Sponsorship; and
    4.   (d) study is permitted, subject to the ATAS condition in Appendix ATAS.
    5.   (e) DELETED.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to Charity Workers granted permission under Appendix Temporary Work. It requires they do not access public funds, work only in their sponsored role (including voluntary work in the same role), and may study with ATAS compliance; exceptions or modifications are not specified.

    2.   (b) work is permitted only in the role the applicant is being sponsored for; and
    3.   (c) voluntary work with another organisation is permitted, providing it is in the same role as the one listed on the Certificate of Sponsorship; and
    4.   (d) study is permitted, subject to the ATAS condition in Appendix ATAS.
    5.   (e) DELETED.

metadata.section_title: Dependants of a Charity Worker

chunks.text: ### Dependants of a Charity Worker
chunks.summary: Dependants of a charity worker must obtain entry clearance to join or remain with the main applicant. They are subject to specific eligibility criteria, including proving their relationship and meeting health and character requirements, with exceptions or variations specified in the rules.
chunks.augmented_text:

Topic: eligibility

Summary: Dependants of a charity worker must obtain entry clearance to join or remain with the main applicant. They are subject to specific eligibility criteria, including proving their relationship and meeting health and character requirements, with exceptions or variations specified in the rules.

### Dependants of a Charity Worker

metadata.section_title: Validity requirements for a dependent partner or dependent child of a Charity Worker

chunks.text:
### Validity requirements for a dependent partner or dependent child of a Charity Worker

CW 9.1. A person applying for entry clearance or permission to stay as a dependent partner or dependent child of a Charity Worker must apply online on the gov.uk website on the specified form as follows:

| Applicant | Specified form |
| --- | --- |
| EEA national with a chipped passport | Either (as applicable): • Dependant partner or dependant child using the UK Immigration: ID Check app; or • the forms listed below for dependant applicants outside or inside the UK as relevant. |
| Applicants outside the UK | Dependant partner visa Dependant child visa |
| Applicants inside the UK | If the dependant is applying at the same time as the Charity Worker, they can be included in the form Temporary Worker where the form allows dependants to be added. Otherwise: - Dependant partner - Dependant child |

1.   CW 9.2. An application for entry clearance or permission to stay as a partner or child of a Charity Worker must meet all the following requirements: 
    1.   (a) any fee and Immigration Health Charge must have been paid; and
    2.   (b) the applicant must have provided biometrics when required; and
    3.   (c) the applicant must have provided a passport or other travel document which satisfactorily establishes their identity and nationality; and
    4.   (d) the applicant must be applying as a partner or child of a person who: 
        1.   (i) has made a valid application for entry clearance or permission to stay on the Charity Worker route that has not been decided; or
        2.   (ii) has entry clearance or permission to stay on the Charity Worker route.

CW 9.3. An applicant applying as a dependent partner must be aged 18 or over on the date of application.

CW 9.4. If applying for permission to stay, the applicant must be in the UK on the date of application.

1.   CW 9.4ZA. If applying for permission to stay, the applicant must not have, or have last been granted, permission: 
    1.   (a) as a Visitor; or
    2.   (b) as a Short-term Student; or
    3.   (c) as a Parent of a Child Student; or
    4.   (d) as a Seasonal Worker; or
    5.   (e) as a Domestic Worker in a Private Household; or
    6.   (f) outside the Immigration Rules.

1.   CW 9.4A. An applicant who is applying for permission to stay and has, or last had, permission as a Student, must fulfil one of the Conditions A or B below on the date of application: 
    1.   (a) Condition A: the applicant must have completed the course of study for which the Confirmation of Acceptance for Studies was assigned (or a course to which ST 27.3 of Appendix Student applies); or
    2.   (b) Condition B: the applicant must: 
        1.   (i) be studying a full-time course of study leading to the award of a PhD with a higher education provider which has a track record of compliance; and
        2.   (ii) have completed at least 24 months of study on that course.

CW 9.5. An application which does not meet all the validity requirements for a partner or child of a Charity Worker may be rejected as invalid and not considered.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to dependents of Charity Workers seeking entry clearance or permission to stay. Applicants must submit online forms, pay fees, provide biometric data, and verify identity, with specific requirements for those inside or outside the UK. Dependents must be linked to a valid Charity Worker application, with conditions met for their immigration process.

### Validity requirements for a dependent partner or dependent child of a Charity Worker

CW 9.1. A person applying for entry clearance or permission to stay as a dependent partner or dependent child of a Charity Worker must apply online on the gov.uk website on the specified form as follows:

| Applicant | Specified form |
| --- | --- |
| EEA national with a chipped passport | Either (as applicable): • Dependant partner or dependant child using the UK Immigration: ID Check app; or • the forms listed below for dependant applicants outside or inside the UK as relevant. |
| Applicants outside the UK | Dependant partner visa Dependant child visa |
| Applicants inside the UK | If the dependant is applying at the same time as the Charity Worker, they can be included in the form Temporary Worker where the form allows dependants to be added. Otherwise: - Dependant partner - Dependant child |

1.   CW 9.2. An application for entry clearance or permission to stay as a partner or child of a Charity Worker must meet all the following requirements: 
    1.   (a) any fee and Immigration Health Charge must have been paid; and
    2.   (b) the applicant must have provided biometrics when required; and
    3.   (c) the applicant must have provided a passport or other travel document which satisfactorily establishes their identity and nationality; and
    4.   (d) the applicant must be applying as a partner or child of a person who: 
        1.   (i) has made a valid application for entry clearance or permission to stay on the Charity Worker route that has not been decided; or
        2.   (ii) has entry clearance or permission to stay on the Charity Worker route.

CW 9.3. An applicant applying as a dependent partner must be aged 18 or over on the date of application.

CW 9.4. If applying for permission to stay, the applicant must be in the UK on the date of application.

1.   CW 9.4ZA. If applying for permission to stay, the applicant must not have, or have last been granted, permission: 
    1.   (a) as a Visitor; or
    2.   (b) as a Short-term Student; or
    3.   (c) as a Parent of a Child Student; or
    4.   (d) as a Seasonal Worker; or
    5.   (e) as a Domestic Worker in a Private Household; or
    6.   (f) outside the Immigration Rules.

1.   CW 9.4A. An applicant who is applying for permission to stay and has, or last had, permission as a Student, must fulfil one of the Conditions A or B below on the date of application: 
    1.   (a) Condition A: the applicant must have completed the course of study for which the Confirmation of Acceptance for Studies was assigned (or a course to which ST 27.3 of Appendix Student applies); or
    2.   (b) Condition B: the applicant must: 
        1.   (i) be studying a full-time course of study leading to the award of a PhD with a higher education provider which has a track record of compliance; and
        2.   (ii) have completed at least 24 months of study on that course.

CW 9.5. An application which does not meet all the validity requirements for a partner or child of a Charity Worker may be rejected as invalid and not considered.

metadata.section_title: Suitability requirements for a dependent partner or dependent child of a Charity Worker

chunks.text:
### Suitability requirements for a dependent partner or dependent child of a Charity Worker

CW 10.1. The applicant must not fall for refusal under Part Suitability.

1.   CW 10.2. If applying for permission to stay the applicant must not be: 
    1.   (a) in breach of immigration laws, except that where the Exceptions for overstayers section of Part Suitability applies, that period of overstaying will be disregarded; or
    2.   (b) on immigration bail.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to dependent partners or children of Charity Workers. They must not breach immigration laws (except where overstaying is disregarded) or be on immigration bail to be considered suitable for permission to stay.

Part: Appendix Temporary Work - Charity Worker
Section ID: CW 10.1
Section: Suitability requirements for a dependent partner or dependent child of a Charity Worker
Topic: suitability

Summary: This provision applies to dependent partners or children of Charity Workers. They must not breach immigration laws (except where overstaying is disregarded) or be on immigration bail to be considered suitable for permission to stay.

### Suitability requirements for a dependent partner or dependent child of a Charity Worker

CW 10.1. The applicant must not fall for refusal under Part Suitability.

1.   CW 10.2. If applying for permission to stay the applicant must not be: 
    1.   (a) in breach of immigration laws, except that where the Exceptions for overstayers section of Part Suitability applies, that period of overstaying will be disregarded; or
    2.   (b) on immigration bail.

metadata.section_title: Entry requirement for a dependent partner or dependent child of a Charity Worker

chunks.text:
### Entry requirement for a dependent partner or dependent child of a Charity Worker

CW 11.1. A person seeking to come to the UK as a dependent partner or dependent child of a Charity Worker must apply for and obtain entry clearance as a dependent partner or dependent child of a Charity Worker before they arrive in the UK.

CW 11.2. A person applying for entry clearance as the partner or child of a Charity Worker must, if Appendix Tuberculosis applies, provide a valid medical certificate confirming that they have undergone screening for active pulmonary tuberculosis and that this tuberculosis is not present in them.
chunks.summary: Dependent partners or children of Charity Workers must apply for and obtain entry clearance before arriving in the UK. If Appendix Tuberculosis applies, they must also provide certification confirming they are free of active pulmonary tuberculosis.

### Entry requirement for a dependent partner or dependent child of a Charity Worker

CW 11.1. A person seeking to come to the UK as a dependent partner or dependent child of a Charity Worker must apply for and obtain entry clearance as a dependent partner or dependent child of a Charity Worker before they arrive in the UK.

CW 11.2. A person applying for entry clearance as the partner or child of a Charity Worker must, if Appendix Tuberculosis applies, provide a valid medical certificate confirming that they have undergone screening for active pulmonary tuberculosis and that this tuberculosis is not present in them.

metadata.section_title: Relationship requirement for a dependent partner of a Charity Worker

chunks.text:
### Relationship requirement for a dependent partner of a Charity Worker

1.   CW 12.1. The applicant must be the partner of a person (P) where one of the following applies: 
    1.   (a) P has permission on the Charity Worker route; or
    2.   (b) P is, at the same time, applying for (and is granted) entry clearance or permission on the Charity Worker route.

2.   CW 12.2. The requirements of Appendix Relationship with Partner must be met.

CW 12.3. DELETED.

CW 12.4. DELETED.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to dependent partners of Charity Workers. They must be the partner of someone with permission or applying for permission under the Charity Worker route and meet the Appendix Relationship with Partner requirements. No additional conditions or thresholds are specified.

metadata.section_title: Requirements for a dependent child of a Charity Worker

chunks.text:
### Requirements for a dependent child of a Charity Worker

1.   CW 15A.1. The applicant must meet the following requirements for a dependent child in Appendix Children: 
    1.   (a) relationship requirement: entry clearance and permission to stay; and
    2.   (b) care requirement; and
    3.   (c) age and independent life requirement.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to dependent children of Charity Workers. They must meet relationship, care, and age/independent life requirements for entry clearance and permission to stay, with specific criteria outlined in Appendix Children. No exceptions are specified here.
chunks.augmented_text:

Summary: This provision applies to dependent children of Charity Workers. They must meet relationship, care, and age/independent life requirements for entry clearance and permission to stay, with specific criteria outlined in Appendix Children. No exceptions are specified here.

### Requirements for a dependent child of a Charity Worker

1.   CW 15A.1. The applicant must meet the following requirements for a dependent child in Appendix Children: 
    1.   (a) relationship requirement: entry clearance and permission to stay; and
    2.   (b) care requirement; and
    3.   (c) age and independent life requirement.

metadata.section_title: Financial requirement for a dependent partner or dependent child of a Charity Worker

chunks.text:
### Financial requirement for a dependent partner or dependent child of a Charity Worker

CW 16.1. If the applicant is applying for permission to stay and has been living in the UK with permission for 12 months or longer on the date of application, they will meet the financial requirement and do not need to show funds.

1.   CW 16.2. If the applicant is applying for entry clearance, or has been in the UK for less than 12 months on the date of application, either: 
    1.   (a) funds of at least the amount required in CW 16.3. must be held collectively by one or more of the following: 
        1.   i) the applicant; and
        2.   ii) the Charity Worker (P); and
        3.   iii) if the applicant is applying as a dependent child, their parent who is lawfully present in the UK or being granted entry clearance, or permission to stay, at the same time; or

    2.   (b) the Charity Worker’s A-rated sponsor must certify that they will, if necessary, maintain and accommodate the dependent partner and/or any dependent child as well as the Charity Worker, up to the end of the first month of each of their grants of permission, to at least the amounts required in CW 16.3.

2.   CW 16.3. The funds required are: 
    1.   (a) £285 for a dependent partner in the UK, or applying for entry clearance; and
    2.   (b) £315 for the first dependent child in the UK, or applying for entry clearance; and
    3.   (c) £200 for any other dependent child in the UK, or applying for entry clearance.

CW 16.4. If CW 16.2.(a) applies, the funds held for the applicant must be held in addition to any funds required for the Charity Worker to meet the financial requirement and any other dependants in the UK or applying at the same time.

CW 16.5. If CW 16.2.(a) applies, the funds must have been held for a 28-day period and as specified in Appendix Finance.
chunks.summary: Charity Worker dependents applying for permission to stay or entry clearance must meet financial requirements if they have been in the UK for less than 12 months, requiring funds of specified amounts (£285, £315, or £200) held collectively or guaranteed by the sponsor. If they have been in the UK for 12 months or more, they automatically meet the financial requirement.

If they have been in the UK for 12 months or more, they automatically meet the financial requirement.

### Financial requirement for a dependent partner or dependent child of a Charity Worker

CW 16.1. If the applicant is applying for permission to stay and has been living in the UK with permission for 12 months or longer on the date of application, they will meet the financial requirement and do not need to show funds.

1.   CW 16.2. If the applicant is applying for entry clearance, or has been in the UK for less than 12 months on the date of application, either: 
    1.   (a) funds of at least the amount required in CW 16.3. must be held collectively by one or more of the following: 
        1.   i) the applicant; and
        2.   ii) the Charity Worker (P); and
        3.   iii) if the applicant is applying as a dependent child, their parent who is lawfully present in the UK or being granted entry clearance, or permission to stay, at the same time; or

    2.   (b) the Charity Worker’s A-rated sponsor must certify that they will, if necessary, maintain and accommodate the dependent partner and/or any dependent child as well as the Charity Worker, up to the end of the first month of each of their grants of permission, to at least the amounts required in CW 16.3.

2.   CW 16.3. The funds required are: 
    1.   (a) £285 for a dependent partner in the UK, or applying for entry clearance; and
    2.   (b) £315 for the first dependent child in the UK, or applying for entry clearance; and
    3.   (c) £200 for any other dependent child in the UK, or applying for entry clearance.

CW 16.4. If CW 16.2.(a) applies, the funds held for the applicant must be held in addition to any funds required for the Charity Worker to meet the financial requirement and any other dependants in the UK or applying at the same time.

CW 16.5. If CW 16.2.(a) applies, the funds must have been held for a 28-day period and as specified in Appendix Finance.

metadata.section_title: Decision on an application as a dependent partner or dependent child of a Charity Worker

chunks.text:
### Decision on an application as a dependent partner or dependent child of a Charity Worker

CW 17.1. If the decision maker is satisfied that all the suitability and eligibility requirements for a dependent partner or dependent child of a Charity Worker are met, the application will be granted, otherwise the application will be refused.

CW 17.2. If the application is refused, the person can apply for an Administrative Review under Appendix AR: Administrative Review.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to dependent partners or children of Charity Workers. Applications are granted if all suitability and eligibility criteria are met; otherwise, they are refused, with the right to request an Administrative Review.

### Decision on an application as a dependent partner or dependent child of a Charity Worker

CW 17.1. If the decision maker is satisfied that all the suitability and eligibility requirements for a dependent partner or dependent child of a Charity Worker are met, the application will be granted, otherwise the application will be refused.

CW 17.2. If the application is refused, the person can apply for an Administrative Review under Appendix AR: Administrative Review.

metadata.section_title: Period of grant for a dependent partner or dependent child of a Charity Worker

chunks.text:
### Period of grant for a dependent partner or dependent child of a Charity Worker

CW 18.1. A partner will be granted permission which ends on the same date as their partner’s permission as a Charity Worker.

CW 18.2. A child will be granted permission which ends on the same date as whichever of their parents’ permission ends first.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to dependents of Charity Workers. Dependent partners receive permission valid until the Charity Worker’s permission ends; dependents children’s permission expires when the earliest of their parents’ permissions ends.
chunks.augmented_text:

Summary: This provision applies to dependents of Charity Workers. Dependent partners receive permission valid until the Charity Worker’s permission ends; dependents children’s permission expires when the earliest of their parents’ permissions ends.

### Period of grant for a dependent partner or dependent child of a Charity Worker

CW 18.1. A partner will be granted permission which ends on the same date as their partner’s permission as a Charity Worker.

CW 18.2. A child will be granted permission which ends on the same date as whichever of their parents’ permission ends first.

metadata.section_title: Conditions of grant for a dependent partner or dependent child of a Charity Worker

chunks.text:
### Conditions of grant for a dependent partner or dependent child of a Charity Worker

1.   CW 18.3. The grant will be subject to all the following conditions: 
    1.   (a) no access to public funds; and
    2.   (b) work (including self-employment and voluntary work) is permitted, except as a professional sportsperson (including as a sports coach); and
    3.   (c) study is permitted, subject to the ATAS condition in Appendix ATAS if the applicant is over the age of 18.
    4.   (d) DELETED.

Print this page
chunks.summary: Dependent partners and children of Charity Workers must not access public funds; they are permitted to work and study (with ATAS if over 18), except as professional sportspeople. Conditions apply uniformly, with no exceptions noted.
